name: (4E)-4-{[5-(4-nitrophenyl)furan-2-yl]methylidene}-2-phenyl-1,3-oxazol-5(4H)-one
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1194
Reason: The compound has a melting point of 5.5 degrees Celsius for the base unit benzene. The nitro group contributes to the melting point due to its electronegative nature and the capability for intermolecular interactions, estimated at +30 degrees. The furan ring contributes to the melting point due to increased molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, estimated at +40 degrees. The methyl group attached to the benzene ring also contributes to van der Waals interactions, estimated at +10 degrees. The phenyl group contributes to the melting point due to increased molecular weight and electronegativity, estimated at +20 degrees. The oxazol-5(4H)-one moiety introduces two oxygen atoms within a ring structure, potentially adding further intermolecular hydrogen bonding opportunities, estimated at +20 degrees. The presence of a nitro group can significantly increase the melting point because of its strong electronegative nature and the capability for intermolecular interactions, contributing approximately +30°C. The cumulative effect of all functional groups can be estimated as follows: Benzene (5.5) + 2 Furan rings (2 * 40) + 1 Nitro group (30) + 1 Phenyl group (20) + 2 Oxazol-5(4H)-one (20) - Conjugation (5) = 5.5 + 80 + 30 + 20 + 20 + 5 = 180.5 degrees Celsius.
